subject: Personal Finance
title: Venezuela's Modern Collapse
description: A short lesson to help you apply Venezuela's Modern Collapse.

hook.text: Venezuela sits on the world's largest oil reserves. Its people can't afford basic food.

buildup.text: Oil prices crashed in 2014. The government kept spending by printing bolivars.

discovery.text: Inflation hit one million percent in 2018. The currency lost 99.9% of its value.

twist.text: Price controls made it worse. When bread is priced below cost, bakers stop making bread.

climax.text: Millions fled the country. Venezuela shows that resource wealth can't protect against bad monetary policy.

punchline.text: Oil wealth is no shield against bad policy.

quiz.question: What made Venezuela's inflation crisis worse?
